fair-value.title: Fair Value
fair-value.tooltip: The fair value represents the ratio at which users can stake/unstake one token. For reward-earning (rebasing) tokens, the value should always be 1 to 1 because user's wallet balance increase in a daily basis, simulating as such earned staking rewards.
fair-value.tooltip-aethc: The fair value represents the staking value of 1 aETHc, which should always increase and be above 1 ETH as ETH2 staking rewards are accumulated in Ankr's staking pool. At phase 1.5 of Ethereum 2.0, unstaking ETH will become possible and staked ETH can be redeemed at fair value.

faq.question-1: Where can I find a detailed tutorial for AVAX staking?
faq.answer-1: Yes - there‚Äôs a user guide you can find in the docs.
faq.question-2: What is the minimum amount of AVAX I can stake?
faq.question-3: What is the unstaking period of aAVAXb?
faq.answer-3: The unstaking period is a maximum of 28 days. Every 28 days, there is at least one validator node reaching the end of its locking period.
faq.answer-4: aAVAXb is a rebasing token. When holding aAVAXb, your balance will increase in proportion to your AVAX staking rewards. A rebase runs daily, and rewards occur each time this runs. So every day, you can see that the quantity of your aAVAXb has increased by a small amount.
faq.question-5: How soon after staking will I begin to receive rewards?
faq.answer-5: Your aAVAXb balance will increase with every rebase; rebasing occurs daily.
faq.question-6: Does Ankr charge for this service?
faq.answer-6: Ankr takes 2% of AVAX liquid Staking reward as a service fee.
faq.question-7: What determines the amount of rewards that I receive through rebase?
faq.answer-7:
Staking rewards depend mostly on how long your staked AVAX is locked. Ankr Staking splits the total staking amount between two nodes with a lock period of 56 days with a time shift of 28 days from one another.

aAVAXb holders will therefore get the average staking rewards of all staked AVAX through Ankr Staking and ability to unstake any tyme with an unbonding period not more than 28 days.
faq.question-8: Is there any risk from Liquid staking, like slashing or any penalties?
faq.answer-8:
The only risk for stakers is reducing out on rewards if Validator node users are offline 20% of the time relative to other Validator nodes.

However, staked AVAX will not be slashed. Ankr only delegates to his own Validator nodes and has a dedicated developers‚Äô team who monitor node performance!
faq.question-9: Is there liquidity for aAVAXb anywhere currently?
faq.answer-9: You can check all available DeFi platforms and options on ANKR DeFi.

tooltips.you-will-get:
aAVAXb represents your staked AVAX plus accumulated staking rewards. Your wallet‚Äôs aAVAXb balance will grow daily to reflect earned rewards.

You can unstake it at fair value (1 aAVAXb = 1 AVAX) anytime after the unbonding period (1-28 days depending on validator's closest unlocking date).

unstake.timer: You will get your AVAX in: {duration}
unstake.timer-off: You will get your AVAX shortly

stake-avax.aavaxb-descr:
aAVAXb (reward earning) its quantity grows daily just being on your wallet. Redemption ratio is always:
1 aAVAXb=1 AVAX
stake-avax.aavaxc-descr:
aAVAX—Å (reward bearing) its quantity is stable, but redemption ratio grows daily.
Current rate is 1 aAVAXc={rate} AVAX

faq.question-1: Where can I find a detailed tutorial for BNB staking?
faq.answer-1: Yes - there‚Äôs a user guide you can find in the docs.
faq.question-2: What is the minimum amount of BNB I can stake?
faq.answer-2: {total} BNB: {minStake} BNB, plus the relayer fee ‚Äî {relayerFee} BNB. You must also count in the gas fee on top for sending the transaction.
faq.question-3: Why do I get less aBNBc than aBNBb for my 1 BNB?
faq.answer-3: aBNBb is a rebasing token that changes in number, which is why we decided 1 aBNBb is equal to 1 BNB. However, aBNBc only changes in value, which is why the amount of aBNBc you get when staking is calculated by the formula stake * exchange_ratio. The exchange ratio is calculated like this: totals_supply_of_abnbc / (total_staked_bnb + total_rewards_for_staked_bnb - total_unstaked_abnbb_and_abnbc).
faq.question-4: Is there a maximum amount I can stake?
faq.answer-4: No, you can stake at your discretion, unlimited.
faq.question-5: What is the unbonding period for aBNBb/aBNBc?
faq.answer-6:
aBNBb is a rebasing token. When holding aBNBb, your balance will increase in proportion to your BNB staking rewards. A rebase runs daily, and rewards occur each time this runs. So each day, you will see the quantity of your aBNBb increase by a small amount.
aBNBc is a reward-bearing token, meaning its quantity stays the same from the moment of staking. Instead, it appreciates in value, as the redemption ratio grows because of reward accumulation.
faq.question-7: How soon after staking will I begin to receive rewards?
faq.answer-7: aBNBb will increase in number with every rebase; rebasing occurs daily. aBNBc will increase in value, daily.
faq.question-8: Does Ankr charge for the service?
faq.answer-8: ANKR does not charge any service fees for BNB Liquid Staking. However, validators charge a delegate stake fee, representing an indirect cost for liquid staking token holders: Ankr validator charges 2% from the rewards, BNB48 Club validator charges 0.48% from the rewards.
faq.question-9: What determines the amount of reward I receive each rebase of aBNBb or appreciation of aBNBc?
faq.answer-9: Staking rewards depend mostly on the voting power of the validator node that your stake is delegated to and how much BNB is validated on the network. The less BNB is staked, the higher the rewards to incentivize more BNB to come online, and vice versa. Ankr aims to spread delegations to only the most trustworthy and reliable nodes to increase staking rewards.
faq.question-10: Is there any risk from staking, like slashing or any penalties?
faq.answer-10: The only risk for stakers is missing out on rewards during any time a validator they staked with is ‚Äúin jail‚Äù (slashed). Slashing is a protocol-level penalty associated with a validator failure if it validates an invalid transaction or goes offline. The delegated staked BNB is not slashed ‚Äî slashing impacts only the self-stake of the validator. Ankr only delegates to trusted and reputable validator nodes to avoid any validator that would act maliciously.
faq.question-11: Is there any liquidity for aBNBb/aBNBc anywhere currently?
faq.answer-11:
You can check all available DeFi platforms on ANKR DeFi:
- aBNBb
- aBNBc (coming soon)

stake-bnb.abnbc-descr:
aBNB—Å (reward bearing) its quantity is stable, but redemption ratio grows daily.

faq.question-1: Which wallets are compatible with the a{network}b tokens?
faq.answer-1: a{network}b is an ERC-20 token that is compatible with Ethereum-based wallets like Metamask.
faq.question-2: Are there any docs about the {network} staking and how I set up my wallet etc.?
faq.answer-2: Yes ‚Äî there is a user guide.
faq.question-3: What is the minimum amount of {network} I can stake?
faq.question-4: Is there a maximum amount I can stake?
faq.answer-4: No, you can stake at your discretion, unlimited.
faq.question-5: What is the unbonding period for a{network}b?
faq.answer-5: You receive the unstaked amount after the unbonding period of up to ~{period} days.
faq.answer-6: a{network}b is a rebasing token. When holding a{network}b, your balance will increase in proportion to your {network} staking rewards. A rebase runs daily, and rewards occur each time this runs. So each day, you will see the quantity of your a{network}b increase by a small amount.
faq.question-7: How soon after staking will I begin to receive rewards?
faq.answer-7: a{network}b will increase with every rebase; rebasing occurs daily.
faq.question-8: Does Ankr charge for the service?
faq.question-9: What determines the amount of reward I receive each rebase of a{network}b?
faq.answer-9: Staking rewards depend mostly on the voting power of the validator node that your stake is delegated to. Ankr aims to spread delegations to only the most trustworthy and reliable nodes to increase staking rewards.
faq.question-10: Is there any risk from staking, like slashing or any penalties?
faq.answer-10: The only risk for stakers is missing out on rewards during any time a validator they staked with is slashed. Slashing is a protocol-level penalty associated with a validator failure if it validates an invalid transaction, attacks the network, or goes offline. The delegated staked {network} is not slashed ‚Äî slashing impacts only the self-stake of the validator. Ankr only delegates to trusted and reputable validator nodes to avoid any validator that would act maliciously.
faq.question-11: Is there any liquidity for a{network}b anywhere currently?
faq.answer-11: You can check all available DeFi platforms and options on ANKR DeFi.

a{token}b represents your staked {token} and provides liquidity for your staked position.

a{token}b balance in your wallet grows daily to reflect the earned rewards.

Redemption ratio is always 1 a{token}b = 1 {token}. You can unstake it anytime and receive your stake and earned rewards after the ~{period} days unbonding period. While staking, you can also use a{token}b for trading and other DeFi opportunities.

stake-polygon-dashboard.unstake-eta: You will receive MATIC in about 3-4 days.

tooltip.apy:
The Annual Percentage Yield (APY) represents the average annualized earned MATIC over the last 7 days, net of delegation fees from Polygon Validator nodes.

Ankr Staking fee is 0%.

When there are at least 300 pending MATIC rewards, earned MATIC will be staked to generate compounding effect.
tooltip.fee: As unstaking MATIC tokens is a gas and time consuming process requiring sending several transactions to the MATIC smart-contracts deployed in Ethereum, Ankr Staking covers the gas fee cost and charge a modest fee in Ankr to compensate its expenses.  MATIC tokens will therefore be transfered to your wallet automatically as soon as unstake process is completed without any subsequent additional costs.

validation.is-not-enough-fee: {value} ANKR is not enough for unstaking fee. Please, buy ANKR

stake-polygon.stake-info: Stake at least 1 MATIC on Ethereum network and claim the same amount of aMATICb liquid staking tokens (aMATICb) on Ethereum network (ERC-20 token). Your aMATICb balance will increase on a daily basis, simulating as such your aMATICb staking rewards.
stake-polygon.matic-tooltip-body:
aMATICb grows daily just being in your wallet. It represents your staked MATIC plus accumulated staking rewards.

It can be redeemed at fair value 1 aMATICb = 1 MATIC anytime after 3-4 days unbonding period.

faq.title: FAQ
faq.question-1: Where can I find a detailed tutorial for MATIC staking?
faq.answer-1: Yes - there‚Äôs a user guide you can find in the docs.
faq.answer-2: Polygon Liquid Staking offers instant liquidity for your staked MATIC. When you stake MATIC, you will mint and claim aMATICb tokens. These new tokens can be used with DeFi platforms to earn additional layers of rewards.
faq.question-3: What is the minimum amount of MATIC I can stake?
faq.answer-3: The minimum amount you can stake is {value} MATIC.
faq.question-4: How soon after staking will I begin to receive rewards?
faq.answer-4: Your aMATICb balance will increase daily with every rebase. This rebase reflects the staking rewards you have earned for the period.
faq.answer-5: The aMATICb tokens you keep in your wallet will gradually increase in quantity to reflect the staking rewards you earn. This happens daily with a process called ‚Äúrebasing‚Äù (adjusting the supply of tokens) to deliver your appropriate staking rewards.
faq.question-6: What determines the amount of reward I receive with each rebase?
faq.answer-6: This depends on the average staking period of Ankr Staking validator nodes, as well as MATIC total supply and size of the future instant liquidity pool (an indirect cost for aMATICb holders).
faq.question-7: If I unstake, is there a lead time required for this to happen, or is it immediate?
faq.answer-7: You will need to wait for a period of around 3-4 days. This is because the blockchain needs to undergo 80 ‚Äúcheckpoints‚Äù to process this transaction.

stake-polygon.amaticc-descr:
aMATIC—Å (reward bearing) its quantity is stable, but redemption ratio grows daily.
Current rate is 1 aMATICc={rate} MATIC

stake-fantom.aftmb-tooltip:
aFTMb grows daily just being in your wallet. It represents your staked FTM plus accumulated staking rewards.

It can be redeemed at fair value 1 aFTMb = 1 FTM anytime after 3-4 days unbonding period.

faq.question-1: Where can I find a detailed tutorial for FTM staking?
faq.answer-1: Yes - there‚Äôs a user guide you can find in the docs.
faq.question-2: What is the minimum amount of FTM I can stake?
faq.question-3: What is the unstaking period of aFTMb?
faq.answer-3: The unstaking period is a maximum of {days} days. Every {days} days, there is at least one validator node reaching the end of its locking period. The cost of unstaking aFTMb can vary depending on the availability of FTM in the closest maturing node to avoid any liquidity risk.
faq.answer-4: aFTMb is a rebasing token. When holding aFTMb, your balance will increase in proportion to your FTM staking rewards. A rebase runs daily, and rewards occur each time this runs. So every day, you can see that the quantity of your aFTMb has increased by a small amount.
faq.question-5: How soon after staking will I begin to receive rewards?
faq.answer-5: Your aFTMb balance will increase with every rebase; rebasing occurs daily.
faq.question-6: Does Ankr charge for this service?
faq.answer-6: Ankr does not charge any service fees for Fantom Liquid Staking. However, validators charge a delegate stake fee of 15%, representing an indirect cost for liquid staking token holders. Ankr's income comes from running one of the several validator nodes that will be used to stake FTM.
faq.question-7: What determines the amount of rewards that I receive through rebase?
faq.answer-7:
Staking rewards depend mostly on how long your staked FTM is locked with Ankr Staking.
Staking FTM without locking provides approximately 4.5% rewards, or about 14% when locking for 365 days. You can find the most updated information about FTM staking rewards by locking period here.
Ankr will aim to delegate 50% of staked FTM for the maximum possible period (approx. 1 year), 25% for 28 days, and 25% for 56 days.
aFTMb holders will therefore get the average staking rewards of all staked FTM through Ankr Staking.
faq.question-8: Is there any risk from Liquid staking, like slashing or any penalties?
faq.answer-8: If a validator node acts maliciously, delegators will also be slashed as this is an essential part of the Fantom network‚Äôs security. Ankr only delegates to trusted and reputable validator nodes to avoid any validator that would act maliciously.
faq.question-9: Is there liquidity for aFTMb anywhere currently?
faq.answer-9: You can check all available DeFi platforms and options on ANKR DeFi.

aFTMb (reward earning) its quantity grows daily just being on your wallet. Redemption ratio is always:
1 aFTMb=1 FTM
stake-fantom.aftmc-descr:
aFTM—Å (reward bearing) its quantity is stable, but redemption ratio grows daily.
Current rate is 1 aFTMc={rate} FTM

stake-ethereum.unclaimed-descr: Your unclaimed staked ETH balance will be converted to {token} on top of the selected amount of ETH to be staked.
stake-ethereum.unstake-tooltip: Unstaking will be enabled during phase 1.5 of Ethereum 2.0. The release date of phase 1.5 is expected sometime between 2021 and 2022.

faq.question-1: Where can I find a detailed tutorial for ETH staking?
faq.answer-1: Yes - there‚Äôs a user guide you can find in the docs.
faq.question-2: What is the minimum amount of ETH I can stake?
faq.question-3: What is the change interval to increase my stake?
faq.answer-3: {step} ETH. It means you can stake {step}, {stepx2}, {stepx3} ETH, but cannot stake, for example, 0.55, 1.1, 1.88 ETH.
faq.question-4: Is there a maximum amount I can stake?
faq.answer-4: No, you can stake at your discretion, unlimited. You should know that currently staking starts once 32 ETH are accumulated, so if your stake is >32 ETH, it‚Äôll be divided into chunks and the rule will apply to each of them.
faq.question-5: What is the unbonding period for aETHb/aETHc?
faq.answer-5: Currently, there is no unbonding period, as there is no unstaking for ETH. This functionality is to be implemented by the Ethereum team in future updates.
faq.answer-6:
aETHb is a rebasing token. When holding aETHb, your balance will increase in proportion to your ETH staking rewards. A rebase runs daily, and rewards occur each time this runs. So each day, you will see the quantity of your aBNBb increase by a small amount.
aETHc, though, does not change in quantity but will appreciate in value, daily.
Mind that to pull out your rewards, you‚Äôll need to sell aETHb/aETHc on Ankr DeFi, as Ethereum hasn‚Äôt implemented the unstaking functionality yet.
faq.question-7: How soon after staking will I begin to receive rewards?
faq.answer-7: aETHb will increase with every rebase; rebasing occurs daily. aETHc will increase in value only, daily.
faq.question-8: Does Ankr charge for the service?
faq.answer-8: ANKR does not charge any service fees for ETH Liquid Staking. However, validators charge a fee deducted from your rewards (Ankr‚Äôs validator node charges 10%), representing an indirect cost for liquid staking token holders. Ankr's income comes from running one of the several validator nodes that will be used to stake ETH.
faq.question-9: What determines the amount of reward I receive each rebase of aETHb or appreciation of aETHc?
faq.answer-9: Staking rewards depend mostly on the voting power of the validator node that your stake is delegated to and how much ETH is validated on the network. The less ETH is staked, the higher the rewards to incentivize more ETH to come online, and vice versa. Ankr aims to spread delegations to only the most trustworthy and reliable nodes to increase staking rewards. View the current amount of staked ETH.
faq.question-10: Is there any risk from staking, like slashing or any penalties?
faq.answer-10: The only risk for stakers is missing out on rewards during any time a validator they staked with is slashed. Slashing is a protocol-level penalty associated with a validator failure if it validates an invalid transaction or goes offline. The delegated staked ETH is not slashed ‚Äî slashing impacts only the self-stake of the validator. Ankr only delegates to trusted and reputable validator nodes to avoid any validator that would act maliciously.
faq.question-11: Is there any liquidity for aETHb/aETHc anywhere currently?
faq.answer-11: You can check all available DeFi platforms and options on ANKR DeFi.

switcher.title: ANKR Switch
switcher.info: Switch Reward Bearing and Reward Earning Liquid Staking

tooltips.aETHb: Ankr Reward-Earning Staked ETH (aETHb) is a rebasing token. When holding aETHb, its balance will increase on a daily basis proportional to your ETH2 staking rewards. Therefore, the ratio of aETHb vs. ETH is always 1:1.
tooltips.aETHc: Ankr Reward-Bearing Staked ETH (aETHc) is a reward-bearing token.Its value compared with ETH represents the redemption value of aETHc, increasing over time to reflect ETH2 staking rewards earned.
tooltips.aBNBb: Ankr Reward-Earning Staked BNB (aBNBb) is a rebasing token. When holding aBNBb, its balance will increase on a daily basis proportional to your BNB staking rewards. Therefore, the ratio of aBNBb vs. BNB is always 1:1.
tooltips.aBNBc: Ankr Reward-Bearing Staked BNB (aBNBc) is a reward-bearing token. Its value compared with BNB represents the redemption value of aBNBc, increasing over time to reflect BNB staking rewards earned.
tooltips.aMATICb: Ankr Reward-Earning Staked MATIC (aMATICb) is a rebasing token. When holding aMATICb, its balance will increase on a daily basis proportional to your MATIC staking rewards. Therefore, the ratio of aMATICb vs. MATIC is always 1:1.
tooltips.aMATICc: Ankr Reward-Bearing Staked MATIC (aMATICc) is a reward-bearing token. Its value compared with MATIC represents the redemption value of aMATICc, increasing over time to reflect MATIC staking rewards earned.
tooltips.pendingTx: This may take a moment; you can close this window. Once completed you can check out your new {token} exposure on the Ankr Staking Dashboard.
tooltips.aFTMb: Ankr Reward-Earning Staked FTM (aFTMb) is a rebasing token. When holding aFTMb, its balance will increase on a daily basis proportional to your FTM staking rewards. Therefore, the ratio of aFTMb vs. FTM is always 1:1.
tooltips.aFTMc: Ankr Reward-Bearing Staked FTM (aFTMc) is a reward-bearing token. Its value compared with FTM represents the redemption value of aFTMc, increasing over time to reflect FTM staking rewards earned.
tooltips.aAVAXb: Ankr Reward-Earning Staked AVAX (aAVAXb) is a rebasing token. When holding aAVAXb, its balance will increase on a daily basis proportional to your AVAX staking rewards. Therefore, the ratio of aAVAXb vs. AVAX is always 1:1.
tooltips.aAVAXc: Ankr Reward-Bearing Staked AVAX (aAVAXc) is a reward-bearing token. Its value compared with AVAX represents the redemption value of aAVAXc, increasing over time to reflect AVAX staking rewards earned.

token-info.aAVAXb:
aAVAXb represents your staked AVAX and provides liquidity for your staked position.

aAVAXb balance in your wallet grows daily to reflect the earned rewards.

Redemption ratio is always 1 aAVAXb = 1 AVAX.

You can unstake it anytime and receive your stake and earned rewards after the 1‚Äì28 days unbonding period, depending on validator's closest unlocking date.

While staking, you can also use aAVAXb for trading and other DeFi opportunities.

tooltips.polkadot: To connect to the Polkadot wallet, please connect to one of the Ethereum compatible networks first

main.title: Ankr Bridge
main.fee-banner: You will need a small gas fee (of native token) to claim

banner.footer: Please only send your assets to wallets like MetaMask that allow you to control your private keys! Do not send your assets to crypto exchanges as they may be lost in the process

tx.close-notification: Please do not close the window until the operation is completed

description.connect-wallet: Connect a wallet that is linked with the destination blockhain
description.progress: You are sending {token} to the bridge smart contract. After completed, you will able to claim {token} on {network} network.
description.submit-receive: Submit receive transaction to finish your transfer

restore.title: Finish Bridge
restore.note: To complete the bridging process, please enter the transaction ID of the deposit transaction on the initial network

error.wrong-transaction: This is not a deposit transaction. Please enter deposit transaction hash

total-info.claimable-tooltip: You can restake or claim your earned rewards for completed epochs only.
